headline: Constellation Energy Corporation Declares Dividend
summary: BALTIMORE, October 29, 2025--The Board of Directors of Constellation Energy Corporation (Nasdaq: CEG) declared a quarterly dividend of $0.3878 per share on Constellation’s common stock. The dividend is payable on Dec. 5, 2025, to shareholders of record as of 5 p.m. Eastern time on Nov. 17, 2025.

headline: A Fresh Look at Constellation Energy (CEG) Valuation After Meta Deal, Calpine Acquisition, and Analyst Support
summary: Constellation Energy (CEG) has come into focus as investors take stock of a series of recent moves. These include a new partnership with Meta Platforms, a planned acquisition of Calpine, and a nod from Wells Fargo. Together, these have sparked enthusiasm in the market. See our latest analysis for Constellation Energy. After surging on news of the Meta partnership, Calpine acquisition, and a stamp of approval from Wells Fargo, Constellation Energy’s rally has gained steam. With a 58.7% share...

headline: CEG vs. TLN: Which Power-Producer Stock Has the Stronger Outlook?
summary: Constellation Energy and Talen Energy continue to produce a large volume of clean energy and expand their generation portfolio to meet the rising demand from customers.

headline: Constellation and Xpansiv to Launch Clean Energy-Based Certificate Trading
summary: BALTIMORE & NEW YORK, October 29, 2025--Constellation (Nasdaq: CEG), the nation’s largest producer of emissions-free, reliable energy and a leading energy supplier to businesses, homes and public sector customers, and Xpansiv, a leading infrastructure provider for the global energy transition markets, today announced plans to launch clean energy-based annual emission-free energy certificates (EFECs) on an online trading platform.
